title: SCAM TIP#1
desc: Authentic emails usually address recipients by their preferred name or initials, instead of a generic term. Emails from American Express would usually carry details such as the last 5 digit of your account and/or the starting year of membership.

title: SCAM TIP#2
desc: Grammatical and spelling errors are often spotted in email scams. If you are unsure, always call the number on the back of your Card to check.

title: SCAM TIP#3
desc: Hover your cursor over a given link to check the URL is what you expect it to be. If in doubt, call the number on the back of your Card to check.
